name: choppiness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact or quality of stopping and starting, or changing suddenly many times: He believes that the recent choppiness in the market is just a seasonal correction. The choppiness in the text is not helped by a lack of editorial input.
More examplesFewer examplesWhile there could be choppiness in the financial markets in the days ahead, we see more reward than risk at present. There seemed a bit of choppiness to the songs early on, but as the evening progressed, the band grew more comfortable.
